function: Fetch dynamic data from backend APIs for rendering service plans, user account info, and support tools.
static_description: The frontend consists of multiple pages: Home, Service Plans, Plan Details, Support, Account Management, and Login. The body background uses light goldenrod (#FAFAD2) and main components use olive drab (#6B8E23) as their primary color. Navigation bar is visible at the top with links to all major sections.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking on a service plan card navigates to the detailed view of that plan by fetching data via servicePlanDetailsAPI.
Clicking 'Submit Ticket' in the support section sends form data to supportTicketSubmitAPI and displays success/error feedback.
Clicking 'Login' submits credentials to loginAPI and redirects to dashboard upon successful authentication.

resource_dependency.postgresSchemaInstructions: CREATE TABLE users (id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY, username VARCHAR(50), email VARCHAR(100), password_hash TEXT); CREATE TABLE service_plans (id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY, name VARCHAR(100), description TEXT, price DECIMAL); CREATE TABLE support_tickets (id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY, user_id INT REFERENCES users(id), subject VARCHAR(255), message TEXT, status VARCHAR(50));

function: Establish connection to PostgreSQL database and define schema for storing user accounts, service plans, and support tickets.
static_description: Database tables are structured to store user credentials, service plan details, and customer support interactions. Connection parameters are sourced from environment variables.

resource_dependency.servicePlansDataSchema: Table: service_plans { id: integer, name: string, description: text, price: decimal }

function: Enable users to browse available service plans through a dedicated page listing all options.
static_description: A grid or list layout showing cards or rows representing each service plan. Each item includes the plan name, brief description, and monthly price. Background is light goldenrod (#FAFAD2), cards have olive drab (#6B8E23) borders.

interaction_and_states.description: Selecting a plan card navigates to its detailed view.
Each plan card slightly elevates or changes shade to indicate interactivity.

resource_dependency.planFeaturesSchema: Fields: id, name, full_description, features_list(array), price, setup_fee, contract_length

function: Display comprehensive information about a selected service plan including pricing, features, and terms.
static_description: A standalone page presenting an expanded view of a single service plan. Includes title, full description, feature highlights, cost breakdown, and call-to-action buttons like 'Select Plan'. Page background is light goldenrod (#FAFAD2), main container styled with olive drab (#6B8E23).

interaction_and_states.description: 'Select Plan' button initiates a process to associate this plan with the logged-in user’s account.

resource_dependency.liveChatIntegration: Third-party live chat widget or internal WebSocket-based solution

function: Provide customers with tools to seek assistance including submitting support tickets and accessing live chat.
static_description: Support page contains two main areas: a ticket submission form and a history panel showing past tickets. Optional embedded live chat window. Body background is light goldenrod (#FAFAD2), forms styled with olive drab (#6B8E23).

interaction_and_states.description: Submitting the ticket form triggers POST request to /api/support/tickets and shows confirmation message.
Opening/closing live chat toggles visibility of the chat interface.

function: Allow authenticated users to view and update personal account settings such as contact info and payment methods.
static_description: Dedicated account settings page featuring editable fields for email address, physical address, and preferred payment method. Save button updates changes server-side. Layout follows consistent styling with light goldenrod (#FAFAD2) background and olive drab (#6B8E23) containers.

interaction_and_states.description: Save button triggers PUT request to /api/user/account with updated field values.
Editing any field enables the save button dynamically.

resource_dependency.userDataSchema: Fields: first_name, last_name, date_of_birth, phone_number, registered_email

function: Grant users access to review their stored personal profile information securely.
static_description: Read-only display of user's registered personal details including full name, DOB, phone number, and email. Presented within a secure section requiring authentication. Styled consistently with light goldenrod (#FAFAD2) background and olive drab (#6B8E23) panels.

resource_dependency.installScript: npm run install:all executes 'npm install' in both frontend and backend directories sequentially.

function: Automate installation of frontend and backend dependencies with a single command.
static_description: Defined script inside package.json under scripts.install:all which runs installation tasks across client and server folders.

resource_dependency.devStartScript: npm run dev concurrently starts frontend development server and backend Node.js application.

function: Enable developers to launch both frontend and backend services simultaneously during local development.
static_description: Custom dev script configured in root package.json utilizing 'concurrently' package to execute frontend (e.g., React dev server) and backend (Node.js server) processes together.

function: Apply a uniform light goldenrod background color to all web pages’ body elements.
static_description: Entire site background set to light goldenrod (#FAFAD2) applied globally via CSS rule on <body> tag.

function: Style main UI components like cards, headers, and containers with olive drab coloring.
static_description: Primary components such as service plan cards, navigation bars, and content boxes utilize olive drab (#6B8E23) as their base color scheme throughout the application.

function: Ensure optimal viewing experience across various devices by implementing responsive layouts.
static_description: CSS media queries adjust element sizing, spacing, and orientation based on viewport dimensions. Mobile-first approach used where appropriate.

interaction_and_states.description: Layout adapts fluidly between desktop, tablet, and mobile views without loss of usability or visual coherence.

resource_dependency.sessionStorageMechanism: JWT tokens stored in HTTP-only cookies or localStorage depending on security policy

function: Manage user login sessions and protect routes requiring authentication.
static_description: Login form collects username/password; logout clears session. Authenticated routes redirect unauthenticated users to login page.

interaction_and_states.description: Successful login stores token and redirects to protected area; logout removes token and returns to public homepage.

resource_dependency.secureRouteMiddleware: Express middleware validating JWT before allowing access to sensitive endpoints
resource_dependency.dataEncryptionPolicy: Use HTTPS for all communications and encrypt sensitive database fields

function: Protect API endpoints serving confidential data using authentication checks and encryption protocols.
static_description: All endpoints returning private user data require valid authorization header containing signed JWT. Communication secured over TLS.

resource_dependency.errorHandlingWrapper: Try-catch blocks around async route handlers and centralized error logger
resource_dependency.fallbackUIComponent: Generic error page or modal indicating failure to load content

function: Gracefully handle failures occurring during API calls or database operations without crashing the system.
static_description: Errors caught during data retrieval show meaningful messages instead of raw exceptions. Failed requests may retry automatically or prompt manual refresh.

interaction_and_states.description: Displays offline indicator or cached version if available; offers retry option once connectivity resumes.
